The master summoned the chief recorder and asked,
Why did Zhao Wenhe die and come here?
The messenger opened the seal and inspected the records of his age.
He had thirty more years to live.
He was wrongly taken by an evil ghost.
Now he is sent back home.
Because of this, the whole family developed the intention to serve the Buddha.
For their grandparents and two generations,
they hung banners and canopies and held a merit-making assembly. The Continued Records of the Search for the Divine says:

When the five-tiered pagoda was not yet completed, the sword broke at the execution ground. Gao Gou of Yingyang was already fifty years old.

This is from the Records of Miraculous Responses and the Continued Records of Marvels. A goose was about to be slaughtered but obtained a dream and its form was complete. Wang Xi of Langya, the Prefect of Wuxing in the Song Dynasty,

One night, he suddenly had a dream.
A goose pecked up a scroll of writing.
It was about ten pages long.
He took it and looked at it, and it all spoke of matters of sin and blessings.

Because of this, he then abstained from killing.
His faith in Buddhism surpassed that of ordinary people.
Later, he became even wealthier and more noble. Guo Quan appeared in person to urge the holding of a Dharma assembly. The Prefect of Yizhou, Guo Quan, died.
It had been over twenty years.
In the eighth year of the Yuanjia era,

He appeared to his daughter's husband, Liu Qi, and said, I have not yet been cleared of my punishment.
Strive to hold forty monks' assemblies and Dharma gathering feasts.

From the Records of Manifestations of the Buddha. Yu Wen Fan sailed the seas without fear of huge waves. Yu Wen loaded salt in the South China Sea and encountered a storm.

The dead geese startled and ran away, wanting to awaken your mind.

From the Records of Jiankang: The Criminal in the Market of Wu County Is Spared from Execution. The person of Wu County named Shen Ying was imprisoned and sentenced to death.

From the Records of Manifestations. The temple god received silk and immediately left the python's body. The Record of the Temple Pagoda by Liu Qiu, the Minister of Foreign Troops of the Liang Dynasty says:
The Å›ramaá¹‡a An Shigao,
was the crown prince of the king of Arsakes.
The Yin-holding Entering Sutra was translated by him.
He went to Gongting Lake in Yuzhang.
The temple god told Shigao:
I was once a monk in a foreign country.
I liked to practice charity but did not keep the precepts.
Today, I am the god of Gongting Lake.
The area I rule extends for a thousand li.
The people offer me countless treasures.
This is the retribution for harming others in my previous life.
If one can uphold the precepts, one will be blessed and reborn in the heavens.
Because of breaking the precepts, I fell into this divine state. The master was a fellow student and now we have met each other.
Sadness and joy can be expressed in words.
My lifespan is ending day by day.
But my ugly form is huge.
I do not wish to abandon my life here, polluting the lake water.
I will cross the mountains to the west and die in the empty marshes.
After this body perishes, I fear I will fall into hell.
I have a thousand bolts of silk.
In the stone box and various miscellaneous items.
Please build a stupa for me and establish the Three Jewels.
Allow me to be reborn in a good place after death.
I deeply entrust this to you.
Shi Gao heard this and tears flowed like rain.
He then said to the spirit,
Why don't you reveal your form and speak face to face?
The spirit said,

Seeing it will surely cause fear.
Shi Gao said:
I am not afraid of just seeing your body for a while.
The spirit emerged from behind the bed and its head was that of a huge python.
It came to Shi Gao's knees and tears flowed like rain.
He did not know the length or location of its tail.
Suddenly it entered behind the bed.
Shi Gao then collected the silk goods.
He put them all on the boat, took his leave, and departed.
The group of followers all raised their sails and moved forward.
The spirit again emerged as a snake body and climbed to the top of the mountain, looking into the distance as they left.
The group raised their hands and then it disappeared.
In an instant they arrived at Yuzhang.
They then built Dongsi Temple in that region.
The spirit then moved.
It crossed the western mountains and passed away.
The head and tail were over forty li apart.
This is now Shecun in Xunyang Prefecture.
Shi Gao returned to the capital and used the remaining items from the temple.
At Waguan Temple he built a three-story pagoda.
Later, Shi Gao dreamed that the spirit came and reported:
The master performed merit for her, and she was able to leave the body of a python.

It is also seen in the Xuan Yan Ji (Record of Manifestations). The mother of Che burned lamps, not expecting her son to return. The mother of Che suffered from the disaster of the Prince of Qingni of Lu Ling in the Song Dynasty and was captured by the Buddha's captives.

She immediately lit seven lamps in front of the Buddha.
Day and night, she cried out to Guanyin with utmost sincerity.

For seven days and seven nights, he walked alone and ran south.

From then on, they sincerely practiced giving and patience.
Records of Efficacious Vows, Kong Qiong of the Ministry of Personnel.

Because I accompanied Fan Tai to release living creatures,

The retribution of sins and blessings is definitely not mistaken.

In this way, you can escape suffering.
This is from the separate biography of Qiong. The Daoist Shi Jun.
Because of pouring water on an image, he was able to walk. Shi Jun was a scholar who revered the Dao and looked down upon Buddhism.
He often said to people:

Whenever he saw revered images, he would always belittle them.
Later, he became ill and his legs became stiff.
He tried all kinds of ways to seek blessings, but none of them were effective.
His friend Zhao Wen said to him:
Among the merits of the sutra path, the merit of pouring over the image is the greatest.
You can try to create an image of Avalokitesvara. The illness is urgent. Do as you say and pour over the image.

From the records of Xuan Yan Ming Xiang and others, Chen Fan's wife, Lian Guang Yao Zuo, Chen Xuan Fan's wife, Zhang Shi.
With a sincere mind, she revered the Buddha.

Five feet tall, with light, on a high seat.
From the records of Xuan Yan Ming Xiang and others, Zhang Dao's mother, Tu Yan Hui Pan, Zhang Dao's mother, Wang Shi.

The light flowed out of her mouth and illuminated the food plate. From the records of Xuan Yan, the Minister of Works, Zheng Xian, felt the continuation of the mysterious age, with the courtesy name Daozi.

You can thereby extend your life and obtain blessings. Xian then followed the Dharma and consequently attained longevity.
From the Records of Miraculous Responses, Liu Shi of the Ministry of Personnel thought of the image and returned to Pengcheng. Liu Shizhi
always made offerings to an image.
For no reason it disappeared and its whereabouts were unknown.
Shizhi thought day and night, blamed himself,
and sincerely contemplated the profound connection.
After a hundred days,
the image suddenly appeared on its original seat.
Divine light illuminated the room.
The whole family was surprised and delighted.
They redoubled their sincerity.
From the Records of Miraculous Responses, Yimin diligently contemplated,
and the pearl-like face shone with radiance between his eyebrows. Liu Yimin was a man from Pengcheng.
When he was young, he was a Confucian student. He was known for his utmost filial piety towards his parents.
Because his family was poor, he built a hut in the Western Grove.
He often fell ill but did not think of his wife and children.
He cut off all social interactions and diligently contemplated meditation.
Within half a year, he saw the mark between the eyebrows.
Gradually he saw one of the Buddha's eyes.
And the two colors of the hairline.
He also saw the entire body.
He thought it was a painting.
He saw a monk offering a bright pearl.
Because of this, his illness was cured.
This is from the Records of Eminent Monks. When King Wu of Wu besieged the temple and seized the monks,
The floating light of the relic shone above the bowl. At the time of Sun Hao, Wang Zhengbian went up to speak, saying,
The Buddha's teachings should be eradicated. They are not beneficial to China, but to the barbarian gods.
Hao then issued an edict to assemble the monks.
He deployed troops to surround the temple, wanting to carry out the matter of extermination.
He said to Dharma Master Seng Hui,
If the Buddha is a spirit,
he should be revered.
If he has no spiritual power,
the black-robed ones will all die in one day.
Some monks hanged themselves,
while others fled outside.
Hui then purified himself and made a vow for seven days to manifest spiritual transformations.
He filled a bronze bowl with water and placed it in the courtyard.
After the midday meal, the sun's light shone brightly.
Suddenly, a loud sound was heard in the courtyard.
Suddenly, he saw the relic.
It was shining in the courtyard, floating above the bowl.
Hao and the great assembly looked in front, shocked and at a loss.
The debate changed his expression and he continued.
The assembly said:
Your Majesty, if you use the strength of Meng Ben to strike it with a hundred-jin hammer,
the adamantine substance will never be destroyed.
Hao did as he was told.
He first chanted sutras, bowed, scattered flowers, and burned incense.
With a sincere voice, he invoked Maitreya's coming ferry, which has not yet ended.
Then the Dharma wheel will turn.
Penetrating the spiritual path.
The spiritual power is not small.
It should appear today.
If not, then the Three Jewels will be forever cut off.
After speaking, the strong man's hammer stirred up wind.
The onlookers trembled and gasped.
The hammer shattered the relic without damage.
The light stood out, and the brilliance filled the hall.
Hao bowed in sincerity and diligently held a vegetarian feast and lecture.
This stupa is located north of the big market in Jiankang.
Later, there were still auspicious lights.
In the autumn of the nineteenth year of Yuanjia, the temple pagoda emitted light at night.
Bright red light shone.
There were fire-like lights on the four layers, circling from west to south.
Again, a thing was seen like a pheasant tail fan.
Following its movements, its name was not known.

For more than twenty days.
Everyone in the capital city saw a great purple light above the pagoda.
From the Wu lu and Xuan yan ji: The Dingling people were rampant, shooting at the moon and beheaded. The Xuan yan ji says:
In Ye City, Xiangzhou, there was a standing golden image of sixteen feet.
Encountered by the Dingling Shan yu.
His nature was ferocious and violent.
He had no faith.
He drew his bow and shot the image.
The arrow hit the image's face, and blood flowed down.
Even after polishing, the bloodstains remained.
He also selected five hundred strong men.
They pulled it down to the ground.
He melted it down to make copper, intending to use it as utensils.
The statue then emitted a loud sound, resounding like a violent thunderstorm.
The strong men lost their souls and were terrified out of their wits, everyone fell to the ground, confused and rolling around.
Terrified, they were unable to get up.
Because of this, the group of thieves briefly became frightened and many of them took refuge in faith.
Later, Ding Ling became ill and was killed. The ferocious and stubborn He Lian was shaken to death while wearing the statue's clothes. The Xuan Yan Ji records:
When the Buddha's captives broke through the borders of Jizhou,
Monks and laypeople were all slaughtered. The brutality and chaos caused indiscriminate killing.
Even in Guanzhong, more than half of the dead
Women and children piled up into mountains.
He indulged in harming others and considered it joyful.
He then said to himself:
The Buddha is the Buddha among humans.
He deserves to be worshipped.
So he painted a Buddha image
And carried it on his back, sitting in the main hall.
He ordered the monks in the country to bow to the back of the image.
That would be like bowing to me.
Later, he went out on an excursion.
Violent wind and rain arrived, and it was dark on all sides.
They did not know where to go.
Thunder and lightning roared, and they died from a thunderbolt.
After they were buried, there was a thunderbolt at the grave.
The coffin burst open, and the corpse was thrown outside with words written on its back saying cruel and tyrannical.
The people of the country were delighted and resented that he died too late.
After a short time, he was swallowed by Sha Gui, the lord of So Tou, and his wife and children were executed.
See Xiao Zi Xian's Qi Shu and Tuoba's destruction of temples and his body being covered in pus by Emperor Tai Wu of Wei.
He greatly destroyed the Three Jewels and destroyed temples and stupas.
After several years, his entire body broke out in sores and pus flowed all over his body.

The ministers discussed that it was done by the Buddha's spirit. It is from the biography of Cui Hao. Emperor Wu of Zhou abolished monks and his entire body was covered in sores by Emperor Wu of Zhou, who destroyed the Three Jewels.
Later, he developed a severe rash in the Wang Yi Palace.
It did not improve for several weeks and he suddenly passed away. Xie Hui's broken pagoda and emaciated illness continued for years. The Jin Dynasty records say:
Before the Minister of Personnel Xie Hui had not developed the aspiration.
He became the Prefect of Jingzhou.
He said, Monasteries and stupas should not be in the human realm.
They should be moved outside the city walls.
He then led his subordinates to the gate of the new monastery.
Eighty soldiers each holding swords and axes.
They destroyed the pagoda.
The statues were scattered everywhere, tiles and wood fell down.
Suddenly, clouds and fog darkened the sky, and dust and sand rose up.
Xie Hui was frightened and ran away.
The soldiers were startled and scattered, not knowing where to go.
Xie Hui and others dreamed at night.
They all saw monks flying in the sky, with radiant light.
They also saw two people, each over ten feet tall.
With heroic features, glaring angrily.
What you are doing goes against the Way.
You will soon see for yourself.
Later, the soldiers and officials all developed leprosy and died soon after.
The others were all punished and executed.
Xie Hui suffered from chronic illness for many years.
Later, because of his rebellion, his entire family was executed, all dying untimely deaths. The Xuan Yan Ji records:
Wu ruler Sun Hao was extremely violent and tyrannical.
His actions were not in accord with human feelings.
He was with his concubines looking at the land being cultivated in the garden.
Suddenly, they found a golden statue buried in the ground.
The appearance was bright and solemn.
Hao ordered the statue to be placed next to the toilet.
He made people hold a screen and a tally stick.
On the eighth day of the fourth month,
Hao urinated on the head of the statue.
He laughed and said:
Today is the eighth day, I am pouring water on your head for you.
He faced the concubines and took it as a joke.
Later, his scrotum suddenly became swollen.
The pain was intense and unbearable.
From night to dawn, the pain was so severe he was seeking death.
The famous doctors prescribed medicine, but it only worsened.
The Grand Historian divined and said it was caused by offending a great deity. He ordered prayers to be made at the spirit temple.
After each prayer, the pain became worse. The superiors and inferiors had no plan.
There was a court lady
who had previously followed the Buddha's teachings.
She had some knowledge.
Whenever she recorded events, she was often very accurate.
She reported, saying,
Has Your Majesty sought Buddha images yet?
Hao asked,
Is the Buddha a great deity?
The woman said,
Above heaven and below heaven, none is more revered than the Buddha.
The image Your Majesty obtained earlier is still by the latrine.
Please retrieve it and make offerings to it.
The swelling will surely disappear immediately.
Hao, in severe pain, immediately prepared fragrant hot water.
He personally washed the image and placed it in the main hall.
He kowtowed and apologized, single-mindedly seeking mercy.
That night, the pain stopped and the swelling immediately subsided.
He then invited Kang Senghui to receive the five precepts.
He built a great Buddha temple and made offerings to the monks. Zhu Gong killed a nun and fell into the latrine. In the Song dynasty, there was an evil person named Zhu Gong.
He often made killing and stealing his occupation.
One night, he went to Lianhua Temple, killed a nun, and stole her belongings.
He ran around the courtyard all night, not knowing where to exit.
He then fell into an outhouse and died.
His back still carried the object.
Dong Li often stole from monks as a profession.
After obtaining wealth, he would have guests at his home.
Suddenly a mad cow came in from outside.ğŸ”½It bumped into Li, who died with the cow's horns on his head.
Liang Ren Cui Pingye was skilled in archery and horsemanship.
He served as a military officer.
In his whole life, he made a living by stealing Buddha's bronze.
He sold the bronze to buy wine and meat, without any sense of shame.
By the age of fifty, his wife, children, and brothers all died.
Only Pingye was left alone.ğŸ”½Suddenly he fell ill and his eyes became blind.
He died of hunger and cold.
Wang Zhen'e, a Daoist of the Liang Dynasty, had some learning but no good heart.
His words often slandered others.
He was also disliked by the people of the time.
Disrespecting the Buddha's teachings, seeing monks he would always mock them.
Later, he made teaching and learning his profession.
At that time, there was a monk named Faman at Luoxi Temple.
He entrusted a bronze bell at his school.
Before it was taken away,
the governor stole it to cast coins.
Later, he made a vow with Faman.
After a few years, he became seriously ill and his tongue became stiff, unable to speak.
Knowing he had broken his vow,
he gave up his wealth to cast a bell to atone for his sins.
Until his death, he was unable to speak.
This is from the admonitions of the Wang family. Zushan Xinden wrote a letter to the people with white leprosy.
He presented eighteen matters to Emperor Wu of Liang.
Requesting to abolish small temples within the city walls and monks and nuns without proper occupations.
Emperor Wu of Liang did not accept it.
Later, he dreamed of a good spirit spitting on him.
He then developed white leprosy.
Even though he repented, it did not improve.
This is from the Record of Grieving Souls. Yuan Song presented the Dharma and suffered from hot winds. After Wei Yuan Song's destruction of the Dharma,
The body was covered in hot wind and died suddenly. The guest died and the sheep bleated. Yan Shi said:
Wang Ke was the governor of Yongjia Prefecture.ğŸ”½Someone seized a sheep and gathered guests to have a feast.
The sheep's rope unraveled and came to a guest.
First kneeling to pay two prostrations, then entering the clothes.
This guest did not speak of it at all.
There was no request for rescue.
Soon it was cooked and served to the guests.
As soon as a piece was put in the mouth, it went down into the skin.
The body was in excruciating pain all over, howling.
Only then did he speak of it.
He turned into the bleating of a sheep and died. The county magistrate woke up and his sores erupted. At that time, someone was the county magistrate and stayed in the temple.
The residents brought beef and wine to congratulate the magistrate.
The magistrate then tied the ox to the pillar of the temple.
Removing the Buddha images and setting up a bed and seat.
In the Buddha hall, he received guests.
Before it was killed, the ox untied itself and came to the steps to pay homage.
The county magistrate laughed loudly.
He ordered his attendants to slaughter it.
After drinking and eating to his satisfaction, he lay down under the eaves.
When he woke up, he found his body itchy.
He scratched it with his hand, and as a result
he became leprous.
He died after ten years.
This story is from the Yan Shi Family Instructions. The son of a subordinate was born naturally without hands.
The court official ate roasted meat as if a sword entered his body. Yang Sidachang was the governor of Xiyang.
He encountered the chaos of Hou Jing.
At that time, there was a drought and famine.
The people stole wheat from the fields.
Sidachang sent a subordinate to guard it.
Those who were caught stealing would have their arms cut off.
In total, more than ten people had their arms cut off. Later, the subordinate gave birth to a son.
He was naturally without hands.
In the state of Qi, there was a court official who was very wealthy.
If he did not kill the cow with his own hands, he would not eat it.
When he was about thirty years old, he became seriously ill and saw a cow coming to touch his body.
It was as if he was being stabbed by a knife. He screamed and died.

From the Book of the Yan Family. A person of the Liang dynasty who washed his hair and heard the sound of chickens on the top of his head. The people of the Liang dynasty often mixed chicken egg whites with their hair wash.
It was said to make the hair shiny.
Every time he washed his hair, he would break twenty or thirty chicken eggs.
At the end of his life, he only heard the sound of several thousand chicks chirping in his hair.
From the Book of the Yan Family. Liu's wife sold soup, and her son's head resembled a sturgeon. Liu's family in Jiangling made a living by selling sturgeon soup.
Later, they gave birth to a son.
His head really was a sturgeon.
From the neck down, he had a human body. From the Book of the Yan Family. Observing the traces of faith and slander,
It is truly due to the shadow following the form,
And the valley transmitting the echo.
The ears hear it and the eyes verify it.
It can be briefly mentioned.
How diligent, my son!
Fortunately, you are able to save yourself.
The Confucian student said:
Examining the teacher's sincere purport,
Then good and evil are distinct, and faith and slander are reciprocated.
I secretly see that Yan Hui's virtuous conduct was met with an early death.
